intro: Hybanthus yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in the early morning, producing vibrant blue or purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Hybanthus yucatanensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
